div.p: D73/9914, unit 1022, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to return herewith the account for salary (including allowance for houserent) signed by me. I further beg to submit the paysheet for the remuneration of the assistant and attendent
assistant and attendent both underlined in pencil. Marginal note by [Francis] against 'assitant' '9/- per diem' and against 'attendent' '7/6' per year too. attendent - sic.
of my Department for the month of July, and also some incidental accounts, concerning the service of that month, trusting that they will meet with your favorable consideration and approval.
MS annotation, on 6 August 1871, by [Francis]: 'Dr Mueller must recognize that £ 300 in the 1873/4 Estimates is for collecting Botanical specimens clerical assistance &c and that the [present] […] will not permit of two assistants […] therefore one must be dispensed with as no Supplementary Estimate will be asked for —'.
I have the honor to be, Sir, your obedient servant

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller
MS annotation, the same day, by M: 'Baron von Muellers respectful reply is attached.' See M to J. Francis, 6 August 1871.
